steps.title: Mix the juice, oil, garlic, and thyme in a sealable bag.
steps.content: Mix the juice, oil, garlic, and thyme in a sealable bag. Open a large bag and pour in 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice along with 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of olive oil. Then, add 2 minced cloves of garlic and 2 teaspoons (1.5 g) of minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of dried thyme. Press out the air and seal the bag tightly. [1] X Research source You can shake the marinade around to combine the ingredients. If you prefer, use your favorite marinade or just season the tuna with oil, salt, and pepper.

steps.title: Add the tuna steaks and refrigerate them for up to 30 minutes.
steps.content: Add the tuna steaks and refrigerate them for up to 30 minutes. Get out 4 tuna steaks that are around 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick and put them in the bag with the garlic herb marinade. Seal the bag and then turn the bag over a few times so the tuna steaks are coated. [2] X Research source Avoid marinating the tuna steaks for more than 30 minutes or the acidic lemon juice could make them become mushy.

steps.title: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high.
steps.content: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high. If you're using a gas grill, turn the burners to medium-high. If you're using a charcoal grill, fill a chimney with briquettes and light them. Dump the briquettes onto 1 side of the grill once they're hot and lightly covered with ash. [3] X Research source If you're using a broiler, preheat it for at least 5 minutes before cooking the tuna steaks.

steps.title: Take the steaks out of the bag and season them with salt and pepper.
steps.content: Take the steaks out of the bag and season them with salt and pepper. Remove the marinated tuna steaks from the refrigerator and transfer them from the marinade to a plate. Then, sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon (1.5 g) of salt and 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of ground pepper over the steaks. [4] X Research source Discard the marinade once you remove the tuna steaks from the bag.

steps.title: Oil the grill grate and lay the tuna steaks on it.
steps.content: Oil the grill grate and lay the tuna steaks on it. Dip a paper towel in a little vegetable oil and gather it into a ball. Grip the balled up paper towel with tongs and brush the towel over the grill grates so they're lightly greased. Lay the 4 tuna steaks onto the grill grate so the steaks aren't touching and close the lid. If you're using a charcoal grill, you can put the tuna steaks directly over the coals.

steps.title: Grill
steps.content: Grill the tuna for 3 to 4 minutes. Set a timer so you don't accidentally overcook 1 side of the tuna steaks. They should become browned on the bottom side that's exposed to the heat. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the tuna steaks and grill them for another 3 to 4 minutes.
steps.content: Flip the tuna steaks and grill them for another 3 to 4 minutes. Once the tuna steaks are halfway cooked, carefully lift the lid and use tongs to flip each steak over. Put the lid back on and finish cooking the tuna steaks for another 3 to 4 minutes. The tuna should be a little flaky near the edges, but slightly pink in the center. [6] X Research source Plan on grilling the tuna steaks for around 8 minutes total if you'd like medium-rare fish. If you want them cooked medium, add an extra 1 to 2 minutes to the grilling time. Avoid cooking the tuna steaks beyond medium since the steaks will become dry and crumbly if they're overcooked.

steps.title: Remove the tuna steaks and rest them for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
steps.content: Remove the tuna steaks and rest them for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Use tongs to carefully transfer the tuna steaks from the grill to a serving platter. Let the steaks rest while you get side dishes ready. Consider serving grilled tuna steaks with grilled vegetables, couscous, or a garden salad. [7] X Research source Refrigerate leftover tuna steaks in an airtight container for up to 3 to 4 days.

steps.title: Combine all of the spices to make a blackening seasoning.
steps.content: Combine all of the spices to make a blackening seasoning. You can use about 2 1/2 teaspoons (5 g) of storebought blackening seasoning or mix your own. Get out a small bowl and mix together: [8] X Research source 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of cayenne pepper 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of ground ginger 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of ground black pepper 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of oregano 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of fennel seeds 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of ground cloves

steps.title: Heat a skillet or grill pan to medium-high heat.
steps.content: Heat a skillet or grill pan to medium-high heat. Set a heavy skillet, such as a cast-iron skillet, or grill pan on the stove and turn the burner to medium-high. Heat the pan for at least 5 minutes before you sear the tuna steaks. [9] X Research source The skillet or grill pan should begin to smoke. Open a window or turn on your oven vent to prevent your kitchen from getting too smoky as you cook.

steps.title: Brush 4 tuna steaks with melted butter and coat them with the spice rub.
steps.content: Brush 4 tuna steaks with melted butter and coat them with the spice rub. Dip a pastry brush into 4 tablespoons (56 g) of melted butter and brush it over 4 tuna steaks. Turn them over and brush the other side as well. Then, sprinkle the blackening seasoning over both sides of the steaks. [10] X Research source To help the blackening seasoning stick, gently press the spices into the steaks.

steps.title: Lay the steaks in the hot skillet and cook them for 3 to 4 minutes.
steps.content: Lay the steaks in the hot skillet and cook them for 3 to 4 minutes. Place the tuna steaks in the skillet so they're not touching each other. The steaks should sizzle immediately as they touch the hot pan. Leave them for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes and then carefully flip them over. Cook the steaks for another 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. [11] X Research source If the pan doesn't sizzle, turn the heat up to high.

steps.title: Remove the tuna steaks and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving.
steps.content: Remove the tuna steaks and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving. Once the tuna steaks are a rich golden color and they start to flake around the edges, turn off the burner. Transfer the tuna steaks to a serving plate and leave them to rest for 5 minutes so they finish cooking. Then, serve the pan-seared tuna with your favorite sides. [12] X Research source Consider serving the tuna steaks with red beans and rice or baked potatoes . [13] X Research source Store leftover tuna steaks in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 to 4 days.

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and line a baking sheet with foil.
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and line a baking sheet with foil. Move an oven rack so it's in the center of the oven and then turn the oven on to 450 °F (232 °C). Get out a rimmed baking sheet and lay a piece of aluminum foil on it. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Whisk the teriyaki sauce, ginger, and salt.
steps.content: Whisk the teriyaki sauce, ginger, and salt. Pour 4 tablespoons (59 ml) of teriyaki sauce into a small bowl and add 1 teaspoon (2 g) of grated fresh ginger along with 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt. Whisk until the ginger and salt are combined. [15] X Research source If you don't have fresh ginger, use 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground ginger.

steps.title: Put 4 tuna steaks on the sheet and brush them with the sauce.
steps.content: Put 4 tuna steaks on the sheet and brush them with the sauce. Pat the tuna steaks dry with a paper towel and set them on the lined baking sheet. Then, dip a pastry brush into the sauce and brush it over each side of the steaks. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Bake the tuna steaks for 6 to 8 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the tuna steaks for 6 to 8 minutes. Put the sheet into the preheated oven and roast the steaks until they become a little flaky near the edges. Keep in mind that the center of the steaks should still be a bit pink. [17] X Research source There's no need to flip the tuna steaks as they roast.

steps.title: Rest the tuna steaks for 5 minutes and serve them with sides.
steps.content: Rest the tuna steaks for 5 minutes and serve them with sides. The roasted tuna steaks are great with steamed rice, roasted vegetables, and pineapple chunks. [18] X Research source Put leftover tuna steaks in an airtight container in the refrigerator and use them within 3 to 4 days.
